intro: Taxanthema gmelini, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low, sprawling growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with deep roots and succulent leaves. Taxanthema gmelini plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
